channel.title: Process Analysis on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in Process Analysis on Analyst

item.title: Process Injections
item.description: Windows Classic A malicious dll’s path is copied in the memory space of a running legitimate process to be loaded in runtime.

item.title: ðŸ’« System Supernova
item.description: One of the main things to know when performing forensic analysis is knowing what’s normal and what’s not. It would take ages to google every single pinch of this information, that’s why I have decided to make a clean install of several systems and capture their state to have an idea what’s good for each of them.

item.title: MacOS Core Processes
item.description: There are two broad categories of core processes. Processes that initialize system environment and those that initialize the user environment. Whatever is the category, you need to know them well in order to detect abnormal things.

item.title: ðŸ¦ Malware Analysis
item.description: Signed executable. It’s a rare case, but it exists. Around 3% of malware is signed. It’s due to the fact that some systems require executables to be signed.

item.title: Evidence Of Installation And Execution
item.description: There are lot’s of evidence of installation and execution. Based on this data one can prove that the user knew about it or not. Below are the main evidence, tools for analysis and .

item.title: Windows Core Processes
item.description: There are two broad categories of Windows core processes. Processes that initialize system environment and those that initialize the user environment. Whatever is the category, you need to know them well in order to detect abnormal things.
